intro: Triumfetta nemoralis, commonly known as the common triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open woodland or along roadsides. Triumfetta nemoralis is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
